item.title: UEM Sunrise ventures into hospitality with Hyatt House hotel - The Edge Markets MY
item.description:
UEM Sunrise ventures into hospitality with Hyatt House hotel  The Edge Markets MY

KUALA LUMPUR (Dec 7): UEM Sunrise Bhd opened the first Hyatt House in the Southeast Asian region at Mont'Kiara, Kuala Lumpur yesterday. Located at UEM ...

item.title: Khazanah to sell block in UEM Sunrise? - EdgeProp.my
item.description:
Khazanah to sell block in UEM Sunrise?  EdgeProp.my

UEM Sunrise Bhd may be on the list of companies that Khazanah Nasional Bhd plans to pare down shareholding in. The Edge, citing sou...

item.title: UEM Sunrise targets similar sales of RM1.2b for FY2019 - The Edge Markets MY
item.description:
UEM Sunrise targets similar sales of RM1.2b for FY2019  The Edge Markets MY

KUALA LUMPUR (Dec 6): UEM Sunrise Bhd managing director and CEO Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib is aiming towards a similar sales target for FY2019, he told ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise seen to be on track to meet annual sales target - EdgeProp.my
item.description:
UEM Sunrise seen to be on track to meet annual sales target  EdgeProp.my

UEM Sunrise Bhd (Nov 29, 72.5 sen). Upgrade to buy with an unchanged fair value of RM1: UEM Sunrise Bhd (UEMS) registered a cumulative nine months ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise holds annual Iskarnival festival in Johor - The Edge Markets MY
item.description:
UEM Sunrise holds annual Iskarnival festival in Johor  The Edge Markets MY

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd will be organising the annual Iskarnival festival from Dec 8 to Dec 9 at Puteri Harbour in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, to promote ...

item.title: Companies likely to see changes in shareholding - The Star Online
item.description:
Companies likely to see changes in shareholding  The Star Online

THE reduction of its stake in healthcare services provider, IHH Healthcare Bhd, is just the beginning of Khazanah Nasional Bhd’s divestment initiative under the new management. According to sources, there are at least eight more companies, including six locally-listed ones, that are on the list of the sovereign wealth fund’s plans to pare down its stake. Among the listed ones are Astro Malaysia Holdings Bhd, CIMB Group Holdings Bhd, UEM Sunrise Bhd, UEM Edgenta Bhd, Axiata Group Bhd, and Time dotCom Bhd (TDC). As for the non-listed companies, the companies that will likely see Khazanah sell...

item.title: Breakfast briefing: Thursday, May 18 - The Star Online
item.description:
Breakfast briefing: Thursday, May 18  The Star Online

MarketWrap: The S&P 500 and the Dow notched their biggest one-day fall since Sept 9 as investor hopes for tax cuts and other pro-business policies faded after reports that US President Donald Trump tried to interfere with a federal investigation set off alarm bells on Wall Street. The DJIA fell 372.82 points, or 1.78%, to 20,606.93, the S&P 500 lost 43.64 points, or 1.82%, to 2,357.03 and the Nasdaq dropped 158.63 points, or 2.57%, to 6,011.24. - Reuters Energy Oil prices settled at a two-week high on Wednesday after US crude inventories declined for the sixth straight week, a positive sign...

item.title: Trading ideas: MRCB, KKB, Anzo, UEM Sunrise, Petra Energy - The Star Online
item.description:
Trading ideas: MRCB, KKB, Anzo, UEM Sunrise, Petra Energy  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: MRCB, KKB Engineering, Anzo, UEM Sunrise and Petra Energy are among the stocks which could see trading interest on Thursday, says JF Apex Research. MRCB has proposed a one-for-one renounceable rights issue to pare down its borrowings and to finance the refurbishment of the national sports complex in Bukit Jalil. As for KKB Engineering, its 1QFY17 net loss narrowed by 24.6% to RM1.48mil thanks to improved topline from the group’s construction and steel pipes manufacturing divisions. JF Apex Research noted that Focus Lumber posted a 88.92% on-year increase in net profit in 1QFY...

item.title: Big swing in UEM Sunrise Q1 profit - The Star Online
item.description:
Big swing in UEM Sunrise Q1 profit  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: UEM Sunrise Bhd’s net profit for the first quarter ended March 31 increased significantly to RM61.3mil compared to RM3mil in the previous corresponding period as a result of higher property development revenue and the revision of the estimated cost for completed projects. Revenue jumped 110% to RM541.8mil from RM257.75mil for the period. According to the company’s statement, projects in the central region contributed the most with 41% of the property development revenue, mainly from Residensi22 in Mont Kiara, followed by 35% from the southern region largely backed by Teega in...

item.title: Last day to buy some choice homes - The Star Online
item.description:
Last day to buy some choice homes  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Today marks the last day of StarProperty.my Fair@The Curve, where nu­­me­­rous promotional packages from parti­ci­pating developers await home seekers. The fair is open from 10am to 10pm at The Curve, Ground Floor, Centre Court. Admission is free. With the positive response so far, exhibitors are gearing up for a busier and more productive day. Lavish projects offered at the fair include The Luxe by Macly Equity Sdn Bhd, M City and Lakeville Residences by Mah Sing Group Bhd, as well as Begonia, Sefina Mont Kiara and Verdi Eco-Dominiums by UEM Sunrise Bhd. Other participating ...

item.title: UEM chiefs leading by example - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM chiefs leading by example  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: The heads of firms under the UEM Group of Companies will lead their staff and family members at the #AnakAnakMalaysia Walk 2017 this Sunday. The five chiefs are helming their team of 150 participants and their families at the event to promote unity and harmony among Malaysians. The bosses are from the five companies under the UEM umbrella – UEM Group Bhd managing director and CEO Datuk Izzaddin Idris; PLUS Malaysia Bhd managing director Datuk Azman Ismail; UEM Sunrise Bhd managing director and CEO Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib; Cement Industries of Malaysia Bhd (CIMA) managing dire...

item.title: Zamzamzairani appointed UEM Sunrise chairman - The Star Online
item.description:
Zamzamzairani appointed UEM Sunrise chairman  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd has appointed KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd has appointed Tan Sri Zamzamzairani Mohd Isa as its new chairman, effective on Thursday, to replace Tan Sri Dr Ahmad Tajuddin Ali who has retired. A respected and well-known corporate figure, Zamzamzairani’s vast experience in the telecommunication industry spanned more than 30 years beginning with Telekom Malaysia Bhd before assuming key positions in multinational companies. In 2005, he returned to Telekom Malaysia and held several positions before being appointed group chief executive officer and managing director f...

item.title: UEM Sunrise on firm footing with large land bank - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise on firm footing with large land bank  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: With a large land bank of 5,261 ha and potential gross development value (GDV) of RM80 bil, property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd remains a strong company, said outgoing chairman Tan Sri Ahmad Tajuddin Ali. He said the land was inherited with no holding costs and is good for development for up to the next 30 years. “The current soft market has enabled the company to strengthen its internal processes and further build the required fundamentals to achieve goals and vision,” he told a press conference after the company”s ninth annual general meeting here. UEM Sunrise has appointed T...

item.title: Good turnout at fair - The Star Online
item.description:
Good turnout at fair  The Star Online

AFTER enjoying positive response for the first two days of the StarProperty.my fair, the wide range of property offerings by more than 20 reputable developers is expected to attract a larger crowd over the weekend. Organised by StarProperty.my in collaboration with its premium partners IJM Land and Ekovest Bhd, the fair is ongoing until Oct 16. Premium partner IJM Land will be showcasing three of its flagship projects at the fair -- Bandar Rimbayu, Shah Alam 2 and Seremban 2. "Visitors will be able to check out the latest phases at each of these three developments. "In Bandar Rimbayu, it wi...

item.title: PublicInvest: Property prices are expected to hold - The Star Online
item.description:
PublicInvest: Property prices are expected to hold  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: PublicInvest Research maintains that the property market will remain challenging in 2017 due to the difficult trading environment currently, driven by weak sentiment, low affordability, stricter bank lending and rising incoming supply. “The sector is also faced with high property prices (and high household debt) and oversupply in certain segments-such as high-end condominiums especially in Iskandar. “All told, we maintain our ‘neutral’ call on the sector,” PublicInvest said. It believed property prices would still hold up well however, supported by ample liquidity, high input ...

item.title: Maybank IB: UEM Sunrise sales to pick up in 2H17 - The Star Online
item.description:
Maybank IB: UEM Sunrise sales to pick up in 2H17  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Maybank Investment Bank Research expects UEM Sunrise’s sales to pick up in the second half with high pipeline launches worth RM1.7bil. The research house said the new launches included the St Kilda project in Melbourne and Solaris 3 at Mont Kiara. “Management maintains its RM1.2bil sales target for 2017 (versus RM1.4bil achieved in 2016). Unbilled sales stood at RM3.7bil in end-Mar 2017 (3.4x 2017F revenue),” Maybank said. It said UEM Sunrise’s 1Q17 sales were weak at RM169mil, or just 14% of UEM Sunrise 2017 sales target due to the lack of new launches in 1Q17. “First quarter...

item.title: Chance to win a second property - The Star Online
item.description:
Chance to win a second property  The Star Online

FINDING a suitable home is not an easy task nowadays, which is why one should do their homework when buying and investing in their future nest. StarProperty.my aims to provide homebuyers the best chance of securing a house by showcasing the latest property offerings on the market at the upcoming StarProperty.my Fair 2017 at Sunway Velocity Mall, which will also feature the Win A Home (WAH) contest. The contest will be giving the house purchasers at the fair a chance to win a home worth more than RM550,000 at PJ Midtown, Section 13, Petaling Jaya by simply registering their bookings at wah.s...

item.title: UEM Sunrise aims to strengthen presence in Australia - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise aims to strengthen presence in Australia  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd plans to further explore the property market in Australia to strengthen its presence there. Managing director cum chief executive officer, Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib (pic), said the group’s Australian operations contributed between 20% and 30% to earnings in the second quarter ended June 30, 2017. He said the company was also looking to increase its landbank in Australia and was open for acquisition in other parts of that country, such as Sydney. “We are not limited to Melbourne; we are eyeing a few tracts of land there (Australia) but in terms of land size, it i...

item.title: UEM Sunrise records 74.8% jump in Q2 earnings - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise records 74.8% jump in Q2 earnings  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd's net profit for the second quarter ended June 30, 2017, jumped 74.8% to RM95.55mil year-on-year, owing to the performance of its property development business and the sale of its Alderbridge land for RM371mil. Earnings per share for the quarter stood at 2.08 sen. Revenue for the quarter under review was RM897.79mil, up 67% from the previous corresponding quarter. For the first six months to June 30, revenue was RM1.43bil, up 80.9% from the first half of last year. "Contribution from property development for cumulative period increased by 40% contributed by hig...

item.title: Things to consider before moving in - The Star Online
item.description:
Things to consider before moving in  The Star Online

Owning a house is a huge responsibility. There are several things you need to look into, big and small, to make the transition easier. Here is a list of things to consider before moving into your new home. Replace the locks For those moving into an existing house rather than a new development, the first thing to do is change all the locks. Although you may trust the previous owner, there is no way of knowing how many other people were given keys to the house throughout the years. Change the batteries If there are fire detectors or alarms in your house, remember to change the batteries befor...

item.title: Breakfast briefing: Wednesday, August 16 - The Star Online
item.description:
Breakfast briefing: Wednesday, August 16  The Star Online

MarketWatch: US stocks ended little changed on Tuesday as declines in Home Depot and other retailers following results offset upbeat US retail sales data. The DJIA was up 5.28 points, or 0.02%, to 21,998.99, the S&P 500 lost 1.23 points, or 0.05%, to 2,464.61 and the Nasdaq dropped 7.22 points, or 0.11%, to 6,333.01. - Reuters Energy Oil prices settled little changed on Tuesday after slumping to three-week lows as the US dollar climbed and signs of weaker petroleum demand in China weighed the market down for a second day. Benchmark Brent crude LCOc1 settled up 7 cents a barrel at US$50.80, ...

item.title: Top foreign and local stories at 4pm - The Star Online
item.description:
Top foreign and local stories at 4pm  The Star Online

Energy Brent crude was 0.06% lower to US$50.70 per barrel at 3.30pm. Forex Ringgit down 0.07% to 4.2965 versus the US dollar at 3.36pm. Top foreign stories Yuan’s strength against the dollar fails to snuff out depreciation expectations: China has given those who bet against the yuan a bloody nose this year thanks to policy moves and intervention by the authorities. And yet, many traders and investors are still tipping the Chinese currency to decline against the US dollar in the next year. They argue that after a Communist Party leadership meeting in the fall there will be room for the yuan ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise loses to taxman in RM73.8mil suit - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise loses to taxman in RM73.8mil suit  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd’s indirect unit Bandar Nusajaya Development Sdn Bhd (BND) won against the Inland Revenue Board (IRB) in two lower courts, but its luck ran out at the Federal Court, the country’s highest court. The property developer, which is ultimately controlled by Khazanah Nasional Bhd (66.06% indirect stake), told Bursa Malaysia that the Federal Court had ruled in favour of IRB, which sought additional tax and penalty totalling RM73.84mil from BND. UEM Sunrise said the court also instructed BND to follow the alternative appeal route provided under Section 99 of the Income ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise unveils RM1bil property project in Melbourne - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise unveils RM1bil property project in Melbourne  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd has launched its third project, Mayfair, with a gross development value (GDV) of RM1bil in Melbourne, Australia. Managing director and CEO Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib said construction on the single-phase residential project would start in the first quarter of next year and scheduled for completion in the second quarter of 2021. “This project will continue UEM Sunrise’s prodigious presence in Melbourne following our two successful developments. We want to create the next landmark with an equally innovative and spectacular development that redefines luxury. “Today,...

item.title: MIDF Research Neutral on UEM Edgenta's contract win for Biotech Park - The Star Online
item.description:
MIDF Research Neutral on UEM Edgenta's contract win for Biotech Park  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Edgenta's latest contract win has been received with a neutral perspective as it is expected to contribute only less than 1% in earnings to the company in the financial year 2016-2017. MIDF Equities Research said on Wednesday the 24-month long contract is for the provision of operation and maintenance of Central Utilities Facilities (CUF) for Biotechnology Park at Iskandar Puteri, Johor. The contract was awarded by Malaysian Bio-Xcell Sdn Bhd which is a 60:40 joint-venture (JV) company between Biotech Corp Investment Holdings Sdn Bhd and UEM Sunrise Berhad. The research ho...

item.title: UEM Sunrise Q2 earnings up 73%, boosted by higher revenue - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise Q2 earnings up 73%, boosted by higher revenue  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: UEM Sunrise Bhd posted a set of commendable results which saw its net profit surged by 73% for the second quarter ended June 30, 2017, boosted by its higher property development revenue. Net profit for the period stood at RM94.5mil compared with RM54.7mil a year ago. Revenue for the second quarter jumped by 67% to RM897.8mil from RM537.8mil in the same period last year. Earnings per share rose to 2.08 sen from 0.93 sen previously. For the first six months, total revenue increased to RM1.44bil compared with RM795.6mil in the corresponding period in 2016, an increase of about 8...

item.title: Global triathlon series returns to Johor - The Star Online
item.description:
Global triathlon series returns to Johor  The Star Online

Iskandar Puteri Johor will once again play host to triathletes from all over the world in the Challenge Iskandar Puteri, the sixth race in the global Challenge series of full and half triathlon races from Sept 21 to 23. The Challenge is the fastest- growing global triathlon series with 44 full- and half-distance races featuring spectacular courses in iconic destinations in 26 countries across five continents. The series attracts some of the best athletes, with its flagship race in Roth, Germany, (the home of triathlon) gathering an average of 5,000 professional and semi-professional triathl...

item.title: UEM Sunrise targets RM300mil sales from campaign - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise targets RM300mil sales from campaign  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd is targeting sales of more than RM300mil for its Signature Selection: Road to Russia 2018 home ownership campaign. Managing director and CEO Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib said the company was optimistic about the take up rate, in spite of the current property market slowdown. “We have huge expectations (with this campaign) and what we’re offering is exciting indeed,” he told reporters at the launch of the campaign today. UEM Sunrise’s Signature Selection: Road to Russia 2018 home ownership campaign, which is in conjunction with next year’s FIFA World Cup, will run f...

item.title: Developing a vibrant jazz scene in Malaysia - Star2
item.description:
Developing a vibrant jazz scene in Malaysia  Star2

Publika Jazz Festival, Malaysia’s largest free jazz festival, which took place recently, showcased many genres of jazz from different eras. The two-day event, conducted on the last Friday and Saturday of August, attracted more than 8,000 visitors this year. Held annually to celebrate the anniversary of Publika Shopping Gallery in Kuala Lumpur, the jazz festival is already in its sixth edition and has just hosted 120 musicians from all over the world at this year’s mega event. This year’s highlights included NewSound, Fazz, Barry Likumahuwa, Shock and Awe!, Muhammad Nazrin, Travis Tan Experi...

item.title: Zamzamzairani appointed chairman of UEM Sunrise - The Star Online
item.description:
Zamzamzairani appointed chairman of UEM Sunrise  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Former Telekom Malaysia Bhd (TM) group chief executive officer (CEO) and managing director (MD) Tan Sri Zamzamzairani Mohd Isa has been appointed chairman of UEM Sunrise Bhd effective today. The appointment of Zamzamzairani follows the retirement of Tan Sri Ahmad Tajuddin Ali, who had assumed the position in September 2008. Fifty-six-year-old Zamzamzairani has 30 years’ experience in the telecommunications industry, with his most recent role being group CEO and MD of TM in April 2008, of which he retired from on April 30, 2017. He also assumed key positions in several multina...

item.title: Analyst report - The Star Online
item.description:
Analyst report  The Star Online

EASTERN & ORIENTAL BHD By AmInvestment Bank Buy (maintained) Fair value: RM2.01 EASTERN & Oriental (E&O) registered a core net profit of RM33.2mil in its first-half financial year 2019 (FY19), representing a 9.5% increase year-on-year (y-o-y). This is contributed by revenue recognition from the higher percentage of work progress on the reclaimed land in Seri Tanjung Pinang (STP) 2A project and improved sales of completed properties in STP1, namely the Andaman condominiums. Its first-half FY19 core net profit accounted for 31% and 28% of AmInvestment Bank analysts’ and consensus full-year es...

item.title: Property sector deemed winner during Budget 2019 - The Star Online
item.description:
Property sector deemed winner during Budget 2019  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The various property-related measures announced during Budget 2019 will help to drive property sales and lower the number of unsold units for developers. Maybank Investment Bank Research (Maybank IB) said in a report that the property sector was a “clear winner” last week. “While we are waiting for more details on the ‘property crowdfunding’ platform, we view these creative alternative financing platform as a re-rating catalyst for the sector over the short term and it should help to boost property sales and lower the number of unsold properties. “This is further supported by...

item.title: PM launches FundMyHome scheme to help first time home owners - The Star Online
item.description:
PM launches FundMyHome scheme to help first time home owners  The Star Online

SEMENYIH: Prospective first-time homeowners will find it much easier to finance a roof over their heads, with the launch of a new scheme matching first-time buyer with financial institutions. The scheme, designated “FundMyHome.com” and developed EdgeProp Sdn Bhd, was launched by Prime Minister Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, together with Edge Media Group chairman Datuk Tong Kooi Ong at Ecoworld’s EcoMajestic development here, with Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng in attendance as well. The scheme will have homebuyers putting down 20% of the property price, and the balance 80% will be ...

item.title: PM launches Tong Kooi Ong’s housing scheme - Malaysia Today
item.description:
PM launches Tong Kooi Ong’s housing scheme  Malaysia Today

Tong Kooi Ong helped Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad use the 1MDB issue to oust Najib (The Star) – Prospective first-time homeowners will find it much easier to finance a roof over their heads, with the launch of a new scheme matching first-time buyer with financial institutions. The scheme, designated “FundMyHome.com” and developed EdgeProp Sdn Bhd, was launched by Prime Minister Prime Minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, together with Edge Media Group chairman Datuk Tong Kooi Ong at Ecoworld’s EcoMajestic development here, with Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng in attendance as well. The sche...

item.title: A showcase just for men - The Star Online
item.description:
A showcase just for men  The Star Online

PUTERI Harbour in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, is set to be transformed into a playground for men as Stylo International will be hosting the inaugural Gentlemen’s Weekend there. The event is expected to attract thousands of visitors and aims to boost the potential and marketability of Puteri Harbour as a tourism destination. The Gentlemen’s Weekend by UEM Sunrise in collaboration with Stylo International will showcase men’s lifestyle products from fashion, cigars, to big boys’ toys such as helicopters, seaplanes, supercars, classic cars and luxury yachts. The event, jointly organised by Stylo In...

item.title: UEM Sunrise COO takes on new position - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise COO takes on new position  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: UEM Sunrise Bhd chief operating officer (COO) of development Datuk Roslan Ibrahim has been transferred to the holding company, UEM Group Bhd, under the group’s UEM talent mobility programme. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the group said Roslan had relinquished his role as COO to take up strategic assignments in his new position. The group noted that the 59-year-old, who has a Masters degree in Business Administration from Herriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, has over 36 years of industry experience, which includes a proven track record in managing complex infrastructure proj...

item.title: Master of community building - The Star Online
item.description:
Master of community building  The Star Online

WHAT makes a community? For UEM Sunrise Berhad’s managing director and chief executive officer Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib, building communities is all about bringing people together. “You can design the best homes, apartments, shopping malls and offices, but if they lack soul, they won’t last long. The soul can only come from us, the people living there. This is the challenging bit. What excites us as humans? How do we provide places and spaces that evoke emotion? This is what we at UEM Sunrise would like to be known for,” he says. To celebrate the company’s 50 formidable years of combined ex...

item.title: UEM Sunrise will consider cutting property prices - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise will consider cutting property prices  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd will consider reducing property prices only if the property developer’s overall cost to build homes can be lowered. Managing director and chief executive officer Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib said: “Of course we would like to reduce property prices if we can, so that it will be more affordable for the people. “We need to study this first as there are a lot of costs involved in property development,” he told reporters after announcing a partnership with ride-hailing firm Grab Malaysia. Anwar was responding to an announcement by Finance Minister Lim Guan Eng last week...

item.title: UEM Sunrise to launch up to RM500mil worth of projects in Q4 - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise to launch up to RM500mil worth of projects in Q4  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd is optimistic about hitting its sales target of RM1.2bil for this year, as it plans to roll out between RM350mil to RM500mil worth of projects in the last quarter of 2018. MD and CEO Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib said sales and launches, so far, are on track. As at end of June 2018, the group secured sales of RM663.8mil and is on track to achieve its sales target. Its unbilled sales remain healthy at RM4.9bil. Separately, UEM Sunrise today tied up with ride-hailing company Grab Malaysia to extend cashless services such as transportation, dining an...

item.title: Izzaddin resigns as UEM Sunrise director - The Star Online
item.description:
Izzaddin resigns as UEM Sunrise director  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: UEM Sunrise Bhd’s Datuk Izzaddin Idris has resigned from his position as non-independent non-executive director, following the completion of his service contract at the holding company, UEM Group Bhd. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, UEM Sunrise said Izzaddin has also ceased to be the company’s board tender committee chairman and member of the board development committee, as well as the ESOS Committee of the company effective Oct 1. In July, the sudden exodus of Khazanah’s entire board of directors created speculation that it would cause a similar impact on the head honchos o...

item.title: Building communities for good living - The Star Online
item.description:
Building communities for good living  The Star Online

According to UEM Sunrise Berhad managing director/chief executive officer Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib, “It has always been about building communities we all appreciate. It’s the haven we all look for and when we have it, it becomes part of us. We can see that in our developments. “You can design the best homes, apartments, shopping malls and offices but if they lack soul, they won’t last long. The soul can only come from us, the people living there. This is the challenging bit. What excites us as humans? How do we provide places and spaces that evoke emotion? This is what we at UEM Sunrise wou...

item.title: UEM Sunrise to launch first private marina project in southern region - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise to launch first private marina project in southern region  The Star Online

ISKANDAR PUTERI: UEM Sunrise Bhd will be launching the first private marina project in the southern region located here by the end of the year to attract wealthy yacht owners from all over the world. Chief operating officer Datuk Roslan Ibrahim said costing about RM150mil, the project is a joint-venture between the company and Singapore’s SUTL Enterprise Ltd. The latter is a leading developer, operator and consultant of integrated marinas and it is currently the only marina business to be listed in the Singapore Stock Exchange. The company develops infrastructure for integrated marinas and ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise Q2 net profit at RM213.8m, on track for RM1.2b sales target - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise Q2 net profit at RM213.8m, on track for RM1.2b sales target  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd swung into the black with net profit of RM213.79mil in the second quarter as the property developer was on track to meet the RM1.2bil sales target for FY18. It announced on Tuesday the net profit was in stark contrast with the net losses of RM9.84mil a year ago. Revenue jumped by 97% to RM573.35mil from RM290.90mil. Earnings per share were 4.54 sen compared with loss per share of 0.22 sen. For the first half, the net profit jumped to RM239.08mil from RM13.47mil in the previous corresponding period. Its revenue increased by 21% to RM861.09mil from RM711.24mil. U...

item.title: All set for unity walk - The Star Online
item.description:
All set for unity walk  The Star Online

UEM Group of Companies is once again supporting the #AnakAnakMalaysia Walk with 200 employees from different business units signing up for the event. Feeling excited to finally take part in the walk is UEM Sunrise corporate communication deputy senior manager Mawarid Zamzam. “I could not join last year because it coincided with work. The walk is a good initiative and I hope it will grow into a national affair, so Malaysians from other states can join too,” he said. UEM Sunrise corporate communication executive Norlyana Mohamad Termidzi sees the event as a way for her department to hang out ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise maintains RM1.2bil FY18 sales target - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise maintains RM1.2bil FY18 sales target  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd is maintaining its RM1.2 billion sales target at RM1.2 billion for the financial year ending Dec 31, 2018, partly supported by the improved buying sentiment following the 14th general election (GE14) on May 9. Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib said sales picked up in the first half of the year which was partly attributed to the positive buying sentiment which contrasted the subdued uncertainties that clouded the market pre-election. “Currently, our sales stand at about 70 per cent of the target. So, we are on track to achiev...

item.title: Developer offers rebates for 300 units - The Star Online
item.description:
Developer offers rebates for 300 units  The Star Online

THE issue of affordable housing is on the rise in Malaysia. According to Bank Negara Malaysia reports, young Malaysians are finding it harder to afford a house. To help tackle this issue, property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd is offering rebates and savings on 300 of its houses. Located in prime areas of Cyberjaya and Iskandar Puteri in Johor Baru, each unit boasts of modern amenities with prices starting from RM293,000. In conjunction with the company’s 50th anniversary, potential buyers can also look forward to owning their dream homes with a down payment from as low as RM1,000. Among the un...

item.title: AmInvest Research remains cautious on property sector - The Star Online
item.description:
AmInvest Research remains cautious on property sector  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: : AmInvestment Research remains cautious on the property sector due to the generally still elevated home prices; the low loan-to-value (LTV) offered by banks; and house buyers' inability to qualify for a home mortgage due to their already high debt service ratios (DSR). It said on Wednesday, in addition, the still subdued consumer sentiment against a backdrop of rising cost of living and elevated household debts is holding consumers back from committing themselves to the purchase of big ticket items like a house. “However, we do see a bright spot in the affordable segment,” it...

item.title: Country View enters supplemental deal with UEM Sunrise - The Star Online
item.description:
Country View enters supplemental deal with UEM Sunrise  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Country View Bhd is entering into a supplemental agreement with UEM Sunrise Bhd with regards to a piece of land it acquired last year. On Oct 31 last year, UEM Sunrise via its wholly owned subsidiary Bandar Nusajaya Development Sdn Bhd (BNDSB), inked a sale and purchase agreement (SPA) with Country View Resources Sdn Bhd (CVRSB), a wholly owned subsidiary of Country View, for the sale of 163.9 acres in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, for RM310mil. Yesterday, CVRSB entered a supplemental agreement with BNDSB, where both parties have mutually agreed to vary and supplement the terms of ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise to expand RTO scheme - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise to expand RTO scheme  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd plans to expand its rent-to-own (RTO) scheme even as it partners with Malayan Banking Bhd (Maybank) in the bank’s rental scheme. Managing director and chief executive officer Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib described UEM Sunrise RTO scheme as a value-added solution for those planning to buy a house but were in the midst of building their careers. “This will enable the young buyers to plan their finances and facilitate their borrowings. “The scheme will also help to mitigate projects/developments being empty and untenanted, which may result in unnece...

item.title: Big property companies offer value for investors, says brokerage - The Star Online
item.description:
Big property companies offer value for investors, says brokerage  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Big property companies are offering some value that potential investors could look at, according to Kenanga Research. The research house noted that the property sector outlook is still unexciting with the KL Property Index underperforming the FBM KLCI. However, it said, value is emerging with the bigger property companies offering deeper value, firmer earnings trajectories for the near term and decent balance sheets. Its preferred stock pick is UEM Sunrise Bhd with low valuations of 0.5 times forecast financial year 2018 (FY18) price-to-book value. Kenanga Research noted that...

item.title: UEM Sunrise posts higher earnings, property sales double - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise posts higher earnings, property sales double  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd's earnings rose 8.4% to RM25.28mil in the first quarter ended March 31, 2018 from a year ago due to lower operating costs, higher other income and net contribution from associates and joint ventures. The property developer announced on Tuesday the earnings were higher than the RM23.31mil a year ago. Its revenue, however, fell by 31.5% to RM287.74mil from RM420.33mil a year ago. Earnings per share were 0.56 sen compared with 0.51 sen. UEM Sunrise said property development sales had increased by 156% to RM434.3mil from RM169.4 mil. It added that 39% of the sales...

item.title: CIMB Research retains Hold for UEM Sunrise, lower target price - The Star Online
item.description:
CIMB Research retains Hold for UEM Sunrise, lower target price  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: CIMB Equities Research is retaining its Hold call for UEM Sunrise and at a lower target price of RM1.03 compared with the previous RM1.20. Its last traded price was 94 sen. It said on Monday UEM Sunrise was teaming up with Mega Legacy (MLM) to jointly develop 72.7 acres of land in Kepong. The estimated gross development value (GDV) of the land is RM15bil. The 72.7 acres, consisting of 10 parcels on lease for 99 years, will be acquired by MLM from Datuk Bandar for RM416.4mil. “Maintain Hold. Our target price is cut to RM1.03 as we widen our realised net asset value (RNAV) disco...

item.title: Lower Q4 net profit for UEM Sunrise - The Star Online
item.description:
Lower Q4 net profit for UEM Sunrise  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd’s net profit fell by 29.3% to RM37.6mil for its fourth quarter ended Dec 31, 2017, compared with 53.2mil in the same corresponding period last year. The developer’s revenue rose 20% to RM748.1mil against RM624.6mil a year ago mainly due to higher property development revenue from the progress made by international projects, namely Aurora and Conservatory and the sale of completed units from the group’s inventory monetisation campaign. The group also completed sale of land in Iskandar Puteri, Johor in the current quarter. UEM Sunrise is proposing a first and fin...

item.title: Rent-to-own housing scheme open for applications - The Star Online
item.description:
Rent-to-own housing scheme open for applications  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: HouzKEY, an innovative product based on a rent-to-own scheme that was launched last November, is now open to the public in the Klang Valley for applications. It is the first rent-to-own home ownership plan in Malaysia to be fully enabled on a digital platform, where the application and submission of supporting documents are to be made online. In a media release yesterday, Maybank Islamic Bhd said the public can browse through its www.Maybank2own.com portal for a range of properties by 12 established developers which include EcoWorld Bhd, SP Setia, Mah Sing Properties, Sime Da...

item.title: Maybank Islamic opens HouzKEY to the public - The Star Online
item.description:
Maybank Islamic opens HouzKEY to the public  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Maybank Islamic Bhd has rolled out HouzKEY, an innovative product based on a rent-to-own scheme, to the general public in Klang Valley beginning today. In a statement, Maybank Islamic said the public can browse through its portal for a range of properties by 12 established developers which include EcoWorld Bhd, SP Setia, Mah Sing Properties, Sime Darby Property, Gamuda Properties, UEM Sunrise, Selangor Dredging Berhad, and Mitraland. It is expected that 7 more developers will come on board by the end of this month. HouzKEY has been designed to provide an alternative solution f...

item.title: UEM Sunrise to sell land for RM82mil - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise to sell land for RM82mil  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd is disposing of a piece of freehold agriculture land belonging to Nusajaya Greens Sdn Bhd, an indirect subsidiary, for RM82.09mil. The company said in a stock exchange filing that a sale and purchase agreement was signed with KII Morris Sdn Bhd yesterday. It noted that the fair valuation of the land carried out by KGV International Property Consultants Sdn Bhd was RM75.78mil. “Barring any unforeseen circumstances, the proposed disposal is expected to be completed in the fourth quarter of 2018,” it said, adding that the disposal would be cond...

item.title: HLIB Research sees recovery for Kimlun in FY18 - The Star Online
item.description:
HLIB Research sees recovery for Kimlun in FY18  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research is retaining its Buy call for construction company Kimlun Corporation with a target price of RM2.65. It said on Thursday although it forecasts earnings to decline by 22% this year, it is positive on a recovery in FY18 (+20%) underpinned by its strong job wins leading to a record high orderbook. “Our TP of RM2.65 is based on an 11 times price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple ascribed to FY18 earnings (mean: 12 times),” it said. On Wednesday, Kimlun announced it was buying from UEM Sunrise (UEMS) 11.734 hectares of freehold agriculture land ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise 'hold', MYEG 'neutral', Poh Huat 'buy', Comfort Gloves 'buy' - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise 'hold', MYEG 'neutral', Poh Huat 'buy', Comfort Gloves 'buy'  The Star Online

UEM SUNRISE BHD By HLIB Research Hold Target price: RM1.18 UEM Sunrise Bhd has proposed the disposal of 28.995 acres of freehold agricultural lands in Iskandar Puteri, Johor Baru, to Kimlun Corp Bhd for a total consideration of RM82.1mil. The freehold land is located along Jalan Kampung Lalang, off Lebuh Kota Iskandar, near Horizon Hill, Eco Botanic, and Taman Nusa Sentral, within Iskandar Puteri. No planned development was previously announced on the piece of land and the disposal is expected to be completed by the fourth quarter of 2018. Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research is mildl...

item.title: UEM Sunrise land acquisition improves geographical spread, says Maybank IB - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise land acquisition improves geographical spread, says Maybank IB  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Maybank Investment Research is positive on UEM Sunrise Bhd's latest land purchase in Seri Kembangan for the fair pricing and the company's diversification of geographical spread. The research firm expects a marginal one sen enhancement to its real net asset value per share estimate on the basis of a 20% pre-tax margin and five-year development period. "In our view, the shift of focus to Klang Valley will be positive for UEMS over the long-term in term of geographical diversification. With an implied upside of +30% to our TP, UEMS remains a tactical BUY," it said. UEM Sunrise a...

item.title: UEM Sunrise to acquire nearly 20 acres in Taman Equine - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise to acquire nearly 20 acres in Taman Equine  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: UEM Sunrise Bhd via its unit, Sunrise Alliance Sdn Bhd, has entered a sales and purchase agreement with Kemaris Residences Sdn Bhd to acquire 19.24 acres of land for RM109.5 mil in Taman Equine in Seri Kembangan, Selangor. UEM Sunrise said a development order has been approved for the land comprising 924 residential units with a gross development value of over RM700mil. "We believe this land presents an opportunity for UEM Sunrise to create a boutique development for the upper-mid market purchasers. The key selling points for the project would be the location and its accessibi...

item.title: Trading ideas: Rhone Ma, UEM Sunrise, KLK, Magni-tech - The Star Online
item.description:
Trading ideas: Rhone Ma, UEM Sunrise, KLK, Magni-tech  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: JF Apex Research expects Rhone Ma Holdings Berhad, UEM Sunrise Bhd, Kuala Lumpur Kepong Bhd and Magni-Tech Industries Bhd to be among the stocks to watch on Wednesday. The research house also expects Anzo Holdings Bhd and Fajarbaru Builder Group Bhd following their latest contract wins. Rhone Ma has received an amended agreement to stop distributing multinational animal health company Merial’s swine, poultry, ruminant and veterinary public health products. However, the group will continue to distribute companion animal products of Merial. UEM Sunrise is buying a 19.24-acre (7....

item.title: Analyst Reports - The Star Online
item.description:
Analyst Reports  The Star Online

UEM SUNRISE BHD By Maybank Investment Bank Research Rating: Buy (maintained) Target price: RM1.32 MAYBANK Investment Bank Research (Maybank IBR) is positive on UEM Sunrise Bhd’s recent land acquisition in Seri Kembangan, Selangor as it deemed the pricing fair. UEM inked a sales and purchase agreement with Kemaris Residences Sdn Bhd to buy the 19.24 acres for RM109.5mil cash (RM130.65 per sq ft). The land has already obtained a development order for 924 residential units of apartments. In terms of accessibility, the Equine Park mass rapid transit station, which is currently under constructio...

item.title: Westports, Sime Darby Property to be removed from FBM KLCI - The Star Online
item.description:
Westports, Sime Darby Property to be removed from FBM KLCI  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Westports Holdings Bhd and Sime Darby Property Bhd will be deleted from the 30-stock FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI with effect from Dec 6, 2017. According to a joint statement issued by Bursa Malaysia and FTSE Russell on Thursday, the two counters will instead be added to the FTSE Bursa Malaysia Mid 70 Index. The changes followed the demerger of Sime Darby Plantation and Sime Darby Property and their listing on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia. “Westports Holdings will be added to the Mid 70 Index with a shares in issue total of 3,410,000,000 and an investability weighting of 30.9...

item.title: Breakfast briefing: Tuesday, November 21 - The Star Online
item.description:
Breakfast briefing: Tuesday, November 21  The Star Online

MarketWatch: US stocks rose on Monday, with Verizon boosting the telecoms sector after the stock got an upgrade, while a deal in semiconductors lifted high-performing tech shares. The DJIA rose 72.09 points, or 0.31%, to 23,430.33, the S&P 500 gained 3.29 points, or 0.13%, to 2,582.14 and the Nasdaq added 7.92 points, or 0.12%, to 6,790.71. - Reuters Energy Oil prices slipped on Monday, extending recent weakness ahead of an Opec meeting next week, while a rally in the dollar negatively affected commodities across the board. Brent crude futures LCOc1 were down 84 cents at US$61.86, or 1.4%, ...

item.title: UEM Sunrise to buy more land in Klang Valley - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise to buy more land in Klang Valley  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd intends to beef up its presence as a national developer by increase its landbank within the Klang Valley. The company, which has disposed of 163.9 acres in Johor to Country View Bhd for RM310mil, intends to utilise part of the proceeds to buy new land, its managing director and chief executive officer Anwar Syahrin Abdul Ajib said. “It (the RM310mil) is for a combination of things. It will help with our gearing levels and with our infrastructure investments in Puteri Harbour, Johor. We’re putting in quite a sizeable amount of money there,” he...

item.title: PublicInvest maintains Outperform on UEM Sunrise on news of land disposal - The Star Online
item.description:
PublicInvest maintains Outperform on UEM Sunrise on news of land disposal  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: PublicInvest Research is positive on UEM Sunrise Bhd's disposal of a 163.9-acre tract at Iskandar Puteri for RM310mil to Country View Bhd. The disposal of the land, which is zoned for commercial development, is within the valuations carried out. The deal is expected to be completed by Q3FY18. "We are positive on this latest land disposal as this would allow the group to monetise its vast landbank in Iskandar Johor and redeploy the capital either to pare down its debt or invest in new landbank," the research firm said. It estimates UEM Sunrise's net gearing to improve to c.0.42...

item.title: UEM Sunrise sells Johor land to Country View for RM310mil - The Star Online
item.description:
UEM Sunrise sells Johor land to Country View for RM310mil  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Property developer UEM Sunrise Bhd has inked a deal with Country View Bhd for the sale of 163.9 acres of land in Johor for RM310mil. UEM Sunrise, via its wholly-owned subsidiary Bandar Nusajaya Development Sdn Bhd, signed a sales and purchase agreement today with Country View Resources Sdn Bhd, a wholly-owned subsidiary of developer Country View Bhd, for the land in Iskandar Puteri, Johor. The land sale to Country View leaves UEM Sunrise with 10,000 acres of land bank remaining in the Southern Region, totaling approximately RM94bil in gross development value. The land will be ...

item.title: Third Solaris project already 80% taken up - The Star Online
item.description:
Third Solaris project already 80% taken up  The Star Online

LOCATION, size and the property value are some of the aspects that both investors and homeowners take into considerations when buying a property. Tapping into that, UEM Sunrise Bhd’s Residensi Solaris Parq in Mont’ Kiara met these demands and offered buyers their desired property in terms of its location and value. Launched in early October, the residential project has already garnered a take-up rate of 80%. Residensi Solaris Parq marks the first phase of Solaris Parq, the third instalment of the Solaris development series by UEM Sunrise after Solaris Mont’ Kiara and Solaris Dutamas. Locate...

item.title: Country View plans RM1.26bil mixed development in Johor - The Star Online
item.description:
Country View plans RM1.26bil mixed development in Johor  The Star Online

KUALA LUMPUR: Country View Bhd plans to undertake a mixed commercial development in Iskandar Puteri, Johor, with a gross development value of RM1.26bil. In a filing with Bursa Malaysia, the property developer said its unit Country View Resources Sdn Bhd had signed an agreement to buy a piece of land measuring 163.92 acres from UEM Sunrise Bhd for RM310mil, and this freehold land would be the site of the project. The land is planned for a mixed commercial development comprising resort linked villas and shop-offices, with certain commercial plots reserved for later development. Country View n...
